intro: Dasystephana andrewsii f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered dasystephana, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its ornamental value. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its unique floral display makes it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and specialized collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts.
